name: Grimjaw Bonecrusher
equipment: A trophy from an animal you killed (a dire wolf fang necklace)
features: Rage (2 per long rest: advantage on Strength checks/saves, +2 melee damage, resistance to bludgeoning/piercing/slashing)
Unarmored Defense (AC = 10 + Dex mod + Con mod when not wearing armor)
Relentless Endurance (once per long rest, drop to 1 HP instead of 0)
Savage Attacks (roll one additional damage die on melee critical hits)
Wanderer (excellent memory for maps and geography, can find food and water for up to 6 people daily)
traits: Savage Attacks (extra damage die on critical hits with melee weapons)
Relentless Endurance (drop to 1 HP instead of 0 once per long rest)

personality.traits: I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups. I was, in fact, raised by wolves for a season of my life.
personality.ideals: Nature. The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization.
personality.bonds: I am the last of my tribe. Avenging my slaughtered kin is my driving purpose.
personality.flaws: Violence is my answer to almost any challenge. I am slow to trust the ways of civilized folk and their flimsy laws.

appearance: A towering, heavily muscled half-orc standing 6'4" with grey-green skin criss-crossed with ritual scars and old battle wounds. His lower tusks jut prominently from a heavy jaw, and his deep-set yellow eyes burn with barely contained fury. His black hair is pulled into a topknot bound with leather cord, and he wears little armor, preferring to display the scars he considers trophies of survival.
backstory: Grimjaw was born to a small mixed tribe of orcs and half-orcs that lived in the Spine of the World mountains, surviving through hunting and raiding. When a rival warlord united several tribes and swept through the mountains, Grimjaw's people were annihilated in a single brutal night. He survived only because his mother threw him from a cliff into a river. After crawling from the frozen water miles downstream, he spent years alone in the wilderness, more beast than person, before drifting toward civilization's edges. He fights not for glory or gold, but because the rage inside him demands release.
